page.title: 09HOUSES
page.content: There is variety in the type of homes but most are built with Cotswold stone which was quarried locally. Recently built houses are of reconstructed Cotswold stone produced in factories. Rooves are Cotswold stone tiles, some with wooden lintels. Most of the semi-detached houses have porches. The oldest houses date to the 15th century and were part of the old manor. 1 dwelling only in Rodmarton is less than 10 years old (this was permitted because the occupier was an invalid needing a bungalow).Houses in the block were counted and there were 24 detached houses or houses on their own,16 pairs of houses or 32 semi - detached houses with a communal wall, 4 terraces with more than 2 houses joined together,4 farms and 5 caravans which were homes for travelling families on a permanent site.
